We already have docs#Finset.sum_Ico_eq_sum_range which states ∑ k ∈ Ico m n, f k = ∑ k ∈ range (n - m), f (m + k) but we don't have the Icc version.

Is there a reason why we don't have the Icc version (∑ k ∈ Ico m n, f k = ∑ k ∈ range (n - m + 1), f (m + k))? Can I add it?
It feels like that might be opening the door to a huge number of new lemmas. Can you not just rewrite Icc to Ico in Nat (changing the upper bound) via the relevant lemma first?

I find this happens so frequently that I have to first rewrite Icc again and again (subject to other constraints like I cannot easily make new simp lemmas) before converting it into range. But I can get why you don't want an Icc version of everything. Thanks!
Zhuanhao Z Wu has marked this topic as resolved.
